He is best known as an equestrian who competed in two Summer Olympic Games.Sports Reference.com (SR/Olympics), "Takeichi Nishi"; retrieved 2012-8-14. Nishi won a gold medal in show jumping at the 1932 Summer Olympics at Los Angeles. He was also on the Japanese team at the 1936 Summer Olympics in Berlin.Takahashi, Katsumi. "Baron Nishi: 1932 Olympic Gold Medalist for Japan," Journal of Olympic History (June 2003), Vol. 11, No. 2, pp. 46-49; retrieved 2012-8-14. He was a tank unit commander at the Battle of Iwo Jima. He was killed in action during the defense of the Japanese island of Iwo Jima. ==In popular culture== In the 2006 American film Letters from Iwo Jima, Nishi was played by Korean-Japanese actor Tsuyoshi Ihara.Internet Movie Database (IMDb), Letters from Iwo Jima; retrieved 2012-8-14. == Related pages== * Sports in Japan * Japan at the Olympics ==References== ==Other websites== * Category:1902 births Category:1945 deaths Category:Japanese equestrians Category:Japanese military people Category:Military people killed in World War II Category:Olympic gold medalists for Japan Category:Japanese show jumping riders Category:Sportspeople from Tokyo Category:Olympic equestrians for Japan
